model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Classmates A: I just finished my computer course, and I learned so much about using computers effectively.

[MEMORY]
User Description:
Classmates A is someone who used to dance frequently in middle school and is now considering taking dance classes again. They recently got grounded for kicking a door, causing damage, and are trying to be more responsible in the future. They have faced consequences for their actions and are learning from their mistakes. Classmates A also values friendships and appreciates support from friends during tough times.

Relationship Description:
Classmates A confides in Classmates B, who offers support and help when needed. They have a strong bond and value being there for each other. Classmates A and Classmates B are always there to listen and support each other through various situations.

Event Description:
Classmates A noticed Classmates B struggling with homework and offered help. Classmates B thanked Classmates A for being a great friend. They also shared memories of past mistakes, with Classmates A acknowledging their growth and maturity. Classmates A went to the club to see Sasha dance and received support from friends. Classmates A and Classmates B value their friendship and are always there for each other.
